q: the world's most- used search engine, generating$ 29 billion in sales last year.`` Larry Page is ready,'' Eric Schmidt , who will become executive chairman, said today on a conference call. It's time for him to have a shot at running this. Eric Schmidt , 55, who joined the company in 2001, will focus on deals, partnerships and customers, he wrote in a blog post. Larry Page will take over day-to-day operations as CEO on April 4

With her was her husband, Mark Kelson . The three women gathered around her, Debbie Wasserman Schultz recalled in an interview.

the National Museum of American History on Tuesday, the same day Barack Obama Hu Jintao visited the White House, Sen. Bernie Sanders wrote that he was particularly disappointed that the miniature statues of Barack Obamas were made in China. It appears that a museum owned by the people of the United States, celebrating the history of the United States, can not find companies in this country employing American workers that are able to manufacture statues of our founding fathers, or our current Barack Obama , Bernie Sanders wrote.`` That is pretty pathetic! I was not aware that the collapse of our manufacturing base had gone that far.'' Bernie Sanders wants all the products to be made by American companies.

Heads Up| Chrysler weighs changes to minivans Chrysler is debating the future of its Dodge Grand Caravan and its Chrysler Town and Country minivans. We need to completely rethink the minivan, CEO Sergio Marchionne said Tuesday.`` We need to retain all its functionality but make it much more versatile.''
